description.narrative: The Tropical storm Ana and the resulting floods affected the hygiene standards of households, particularly women and the most vulnerable groups, hence justifying the distribution of hygiene material and dignity kits for women. But the floods also caused contamination of water sources, households lost household items, namely, for collecting and conserving water. The impacts of Tropical storm Ana caused the flooding of production areas and the loss of various crops, thus affecting the harvest expectations of the first agricultural season crops and affected household food stocks. Food assistance which can be in direct distribution of food is justified/necessary. Target Group: The project plans to assist a total 500 families (2,500 people) in Zambezia province, Maganja da Costa district, of the total of 4,499 families and of these 1,275 are women and 1,225 are men. Oxfam SAF will target the most vulnerable populations, without discrimination and will work closely with other stakeholders, local partners, andcommunities to refine the selection criteria for different project activities based on the local situation/context. The beneficiary selection process will prioritize thepeople affected and displaced by flooding with priority given to people living with disabilities, chronically ill, lactating mothers, child-headed, elderly-headed, and female-headed households based on their vulnerability. Oxfam and its partners would like to support impacted by flooding with lifesaving assistance with WaSH and Food assistance.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
